    public class LoginMenu
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ItemListener
    This class is a simple loginmenu
    Author:
    Anders, Christian and Olaf.

    • Method Detail

      • itemStateChanged

        public void itemStateChanged(java.awt.event.ItemEvent e)
        Method that updates the Combobox with servers belonging to the network that is chosen in the network-combobox.
        Specified by:
        itemStateChanged in interface java.awt.event.ItemListener
        Parameters:
        e -

      • showem

        public void showem(java.lang.Boolean really)
        Method that sets visible to false or most definitely
        Parameters:
        really - : Boolean.

      • actionlogin

        public void actionlogin()

      • importServers

        public void importServers()
        Method that prompts the user to select a directory where the 'servers.ini' is found.

      • addServer

        public void addServer()
        Used when the user wants to add a new server to the servers-list. Creates a new window with some functionality in it.

      • writeFile

        public static void writeFile()
        When the user has added server(s) to the 'servers.ini'-file, the changes are written to the file, so it is saved for the next startup of the application.

      • login

        public void login()
        Function that creates a new IRCConnection based on the variables set. Adds listeners and waits for it to connect. If connection is unsuccessful or has timed out an error is shown.

      • addConnection

        public void addConnection()
        Tells the loginmenu there is one new connection.

      • subConnection

        public void subConnection()
        Tells the loginmenu a connection is "removed". Also shows the loginmenu.

      • checkQuit

        public void checkQuit()
        This function is called when closing the loginmenu. It closes the program if there are no connections. If there are still connections, loginmenu is hidden.
